Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Ocellatin-LB1 (natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; XXA, UCLL1c; inactive: Ocellatin-LB2)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of the peptide shows 88% similarity toOcellatin-F1. molecular formula: C97H169N27O28S1; Mol Wt: 2193.632; GRAVY = 0.65.Activity: Weakly active against Gram- A.actinomycetemcomitans (MIC 222.37 uM), E.coli (MIC 114 uM). Its activity against Gram+ bacteria and fungi >200 uM.Structure: Structures were determined by NMR in DPC or SDS (Gomes et al., 2018).You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB. Updated 12/2019; 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Gusmão KAG, Dos Santos DM, Santos VM, Cortés ME, Reis PVM, Santos VL, Piló-Veloso D, Verly RM, de Lima ME, Resende JM.2017
Literature Information.Reference: J Venom Anim Toxins Incl Trop Dis. 2017 Jan 19;23:4. doi: 10.1186/s40409-017-0094-y.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Ocellatin peptides from the skin secretion of the South American frogLeptodactylus labyrinthicus(Leptodactylidae): characterization, antimicrobial activities and membrane interactions.
